column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$It is probably really good as an impacting drug to fastly cope with mania. Non the less I hope not to take it any longer. I really dislike most side effects related to prolactin (even if it is what it makes it effective?).

column1: 1$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$11/10/2013 5:54:59 PM$Reviewer: vacinom
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been manic and crashing with delusional thoughts for the past eight months and finally went to a new pdoc. She put me on welbutrin
column3: but I was still terribly sick. I was really ready to give up
column4: and go to a hospital. Then she started me on Invega 3 mg every night and I have NEVER felt this good
column6: have had bp all of my life. I quit smoking several months ago
column7: and have had two months of acute bursitis in both hips
column8: so no exercise. So I have gained about 5 lbs
column9: and think it's the combo of those three things. At this point
column10: with the way I feel now
column11: I can tolerate a little chubbiness!

column1: 2$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$10/23/2013 3:47:36 AM$Reviewer: eagleswolf
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I was on Risperdal for many years.  Looking back after being on the Invega...I wasn't me.  I feel like I'm not in a fog any more or have to sleep all the time.  I can concentrate
column3: I think clearly
column4: I can write (I'm a college student so have many papers to write)
column5: I have my interests back.  I love this medication.  It as changed my life so much.  I actually enjoy doing things now...being with the family...interacting with everyone!!  Thank you so much for finding this medication.  In all the years I have had to deal with my Bi-Polar I have never felt more like myself then I do now (just without all the bad stuff!).  Oh
column6: and a nice side effect is that I have lost 17 pounds which I put much more then that on when I was on the Risperdall.  This is a wonderful medication in so many ways!!

column1: 8$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$11/23/2011 4:23:40 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  (Patient) $3$3$3$

9$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$11/17/2011 10:20:24 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I have read comments here and on another site that stated that Invega causes increased appetite. This has been the opposite for me. Invega actually suppresses my appetite. Plus I have very strange dreams.
10$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$4/12/2011 9:41:30 PM$Reviewer: BipolarChick
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Invega was the only drug to make me sane again.  I have been on it for 3 years
column3: and I have had no episode.  In fact
column4: I am happy most of the time.  I did gain a lot of weight at first.  I gained 40 lbs initially
column5: and now I am 25 lbs overweight.  It just increases your appetite.  Watch what and how much you eat
column7: and you should be fine.  It saved my life!

column1: 11$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$2/18/2011 2:06:11 PM$Reviewer: Dreamweaver11
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$5$"As someone with Bipolar disorder and P.T.S.D.
column3: I find this drug usefull in the short term for acute episodes. However
column4: after 3 months of use the sise effects have taken a toll on my health as risk of heart failure and stroke have become an issue not to be ignored. Wanting relef fom side effects plagueing my helth along with the stubborness of some doctors to discontinue is astonding! Fluid meds have been prescribed to combat this .Also
column5: used in combination with another medication for aniexty whose side effects cause dehydration. Th paradox has become a ""living nightmare"". J"

column1: 12$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$12/18/2010 11:18:17 PM$Reviewer: Jill S.
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on Invega 6mg for over 2 1/2 years. I was diagnosed with Bipolar when I was 18 and am now 26. Over the period of 6 years I went through over 10 meds that didn't work. Invega is a miracle to me. I have not gained weight
column3: in fact I have lost weight after being on Zyprexa. I do have raised prolactin levels and don't menstrate
column4: but my mood is stable and I have not had an episode on over 2 years. This drug has worked for me and even with the side effects I will continue to take it.

column1: 15$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$1/31/2010 8:01:39 PM$Reviewer: happy
column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$My son has been taking Invega 3mg for over a year. His episodes of violent rage have completely vanished. He's a typical teen again. He has gained weight though. About 30 lbs. When I weigh the weight gain versus the violent eposides of rage... The weight gain wins
column3: hands down. We couldn't have dealt with the rage anymore.

column1: 16$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$1/12/2010 5:30:51 PM$Reviewer: rem
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with Bipolar I disorder almost exactly 6 years ago (I was 20).  I've gone through about 7 doctors and even more medications.  The dosage that has finally been successful the past 2 years has been lithium
column3: lamictal
column4: and invega.  I used to take geodon
column5: but my personal feelings of distress (more physical than anything else) made me beg for something else.  And then
column6: whala!  A new drug called invega.  I soon was able to study for school better
column7: my relationship with my then girlfriend now wife went to new heights; I even have been able to sustain a job for the past two years
column8: all while buying my first home at 25 and a new car.  I truly attribute invega for giving me the stability to be myself again.

column1: 17$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$1/1/2010 12:41:02 PM$Reviewer: jen
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$1$5$I have been on this medication for over 5 months and I have gained 40lbs and know its from the medication.It does work for my condition but I can't take the weight gain and I have hypothyroid also so it makes it much worse. I have tryed dieting and exercise but it is not working.

column1: 18$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$12/15/2009 4:04:28 PM$Reviewer: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $3$2$4$my dauter has been on this for about a year now it kind of helps her wiyh her mood swings but she has gaind almost 90 lbs withit her dr says its not the invega but i know it is and its not from eating to much because she dont eat alot.im thinking of takeing her off of it for a month to see what that. im not happy with this pill and would not recamind it for any child under the age of 16.

19$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$9/7/2009 8:35:12 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$3$5$I have been on invega for about 6 months. It causes hypothyroidism I found out from my new medical doctor.  I am going to go back to Geodon and see if I improve or need both meds.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$2$3$I have been on 3mg for 3 weeks now. Since my psychiatrist is able to provide me with samples and it replaced the Geodon I was taking
column3: which also costs a fortune. I will continue but have some fears in reagard to the numerous side effects this drug presents. I have noticed a severe increase in joint and muscle pain and stiffness in my body. I will write an update next month.

28$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$1/8/2009 8:55:13 AM$Reviewer: Meds Expert, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$2$5$The drug works to balance out my mood and to augment (make better) the cymbalta (antidepressant) that I'm taking.  My complaint, though, and this is a big deal to me, is that I gained a lot of weight.  I believe they understate how much weight gain Invega can cause.  If you're really thin to begin with I wouldnt worry about it.  If you're on the heavy side to begin with then only take it if absolutely necessary.
29$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$12/30/2008 1:43:06 AM$Reviewer: selainepar, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$After experiencing horrible side effects with abilify, I was reluctant to try anything that had the potential to cause any of the similar side effects, but with Invega, I've noticed a great improvement in only 1 week. column1: 41$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$3/30/2008 5:22:03 PM$Reviewer: Dennis
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $2$2$3$When I first started taking this medicine I was extremely anxious. I noticed a twitching in my toes and fingers. This minor twitching has continued for the 6 months I have been on it.  I could not sleep when I first started taking it
column3: but was hospitalized for 5 days because I couldn't sleep. I had a tough time trying to get to sleep and when I finally did sleep I sweated greatly!  The sleep problems went away and my behavior was fine for about 5 1/2 months. Now the sleep problems are startng again.  It seems I have slight problems breating and the tingling /twithching in my toes and feet are more severe.  I get real thirsty and drink lots of water.  It as if the systems in my body are shutting down and adrenalin is being pumped into my blood to keep my systems going which in turn keeps me awake.  The drug seems to calm me down but only for a short period of time after taking it. They just uped me from 6 mg to 9mg two days ago.  We will see how it goes.
